description: Component scanning is a core feature of the Spring Framework that simplifies the management of beans and their lifecycle. Understanding how @ComponentScan works can significantly enhance your ability to manage Spring applications effectively.
title: How Component Scanning Works in Spring Framework?

description: Learn how to build a real-time stock price tracking application, Market Pulse, using .NET 8 with GraphQL for the backend and React with Apollo Client for the frontend.
title: Building a Real-Time Stock Price Tracker with .NET 8 GraphQL and React: Market Pulse

description: In Java, a shutdown hook is a feature that allows you to perform cleanup operations before your application terminates. This can be particularly useful for releasing resources, saving state, or ensuring that certain tasks are completed properly before the program exits.
title: What Is a Shutdown Hook in Java and How Can You Use It Effectively?

description: A practical guide to implementing the Thread-Safe Singleton pattern in C# with modern and traditional approaches, including real-world scenarios where each method excels.
title: Thread-Safe Singleton in C#: A Guide to Double-Checked Locking and Lazy Approaches

description: A tutorial that explains how to setup and handle clipboard copying and pasting for X11, WinAPI, and Cocoa.
title: How to Handle Clipboard-Copy-Paste (Low-Level)

description: A UserControl that allows rich-text applications to have a ruler with support for margins, indents, and tabs
title: General-purpose RULER Control for Use with RICH-TEXT CONTROLS

description: Implementations, settings, tutorials, and issue resolutions for a full-featured data service Web API using ASP.NET Core 8.0 with various launch hosts in Windows platform. The code is backward compatible with ASP.NET Core 6.0 and 7.0.
title: A Full-featured ASP.NET Core Data Service Web API with Launch Hosts of IIS, IIS Express, and HTTP.sys
